Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Barely \Bare"ly\, adv. 1. Without covering; nakedly. [1913 Webster]
2. Without concealment or disguise. [1913 Webster]
3. Merely; only. [1913 Webster]
R. For now his son is duke. W. Barely in title, not in revenue. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
4. But just; without any excess; with nothing to spare (of quantity, time, etc.); hence, scarcely; hardly; as, there was barely enough for all; he barely escaped. [1913 Webster]

barely adv 1: by a small margin; "they could barely hear the speaker"; "we hardly knew them"; "just missed being hit"; "had scarcely rung the bell when the door flew open"; "would have scarce arrived before she would have found some excuse to leave"- W.B.Yeats [syn: {hardly}, {just}, {scarcely}, {scarce}] 2: in a sparse or scanty way; "a barely furnished room" [syn: {scantily}]
